message:
Anyone here uses AngularJS in real project and is keen to share which parts they struggle with?
 (Including the ones you worked around)

data.message: I used it once, I remember: turning jQuery plugins into directives was a pain specially when you have a lot of them, flickering problems, multiple/nested views problems
I see what you mean on jquery plugins. Can you name some examples please? I also didn't get the views problem. Thanks a lot.

For plugins I remember jQuery Raty, typeahead.js (Thank god I found it included in Angular UI) and some not-so-popular image sliders and charts. 

For the views problem, I wanted to load ng-views inside each others and keep the 'state' of all of them, have a look at the attached shots, in photo 1 the user searches estate agents and gets a list, when an item is clicked the details view should appear with animation on the right and the clicked item on the main ng-view gets highlighted and all its state including pagination, search term, sort.. etc should remain.. after struggling with this I had to use Angular UI Router and remove some features I was planning to do, I thought stuff like these are definitely supported and I can go crazy as much as I want but I had to find a workaround for almost everything I wanted to do, making them with jQuery would be a lot easier actually but I wanted to try angular.js and I loved it anyway

Routing is something where Ember really exists and Angular is quite behind (maybe until 2.0 this will remain the case). Don't feel bad about using ui-router BTW, it's way more superior, and the guys who created it are pretty much Angular team or so close to it, plus it's going to be main source of inspiration for angular router in 2.0, and so many people and places recommend using it by default.
